description: Quirky Avondale Estates eatery Pallookaville Fine Foods failed a recent health inspection with officials noting a variety of food temperature issues.
title: DeKalb's Pallookaville Fine Foods rechecked after failing health grade
title_page: DeKalb's Pallookaville Fine Foods rechecked after failing health grade
text:
Update: The restaurant was reinspected on Monday and received an 80. See the issues noted by the inspector in the full report: here.
Original:
Quirky Avondale Estates eatery Pallookaville Fine Foods failed a recent health inspection with officials noting a variety of food temperature issues.
The Jan. 3 inspection resulted in a score of 68/U for the restaurant on the English Tudor-inspired strip, according to the inspector’s report.
Among the violations noted was shredded cheddar, sliced provolone, sliced American cheese, sliced tomatoes, shredded lettuce all stored at temperatures above 41 degrees.
Food was stored on the floor in the kitchen, the inspector said. The floor also had standing water and is designed in a way that isn’t helpful for cleaning, the report said.
A can opener was also noted as dirty.
Messages left with the restaurant seeking comment weren’t returned.
Establishments that fail health inspections are generally rechecked in 10 days.
Pallookaville Fine Foods
17 N Avondale Road, 30002
Score: 68/U
See the full report here.
